snippet: Newt Wallace, one of eight carriers for The Winters Express, has been walking the same blocks of downtown Winters, Calif. (population about 6,600) since 1947.
abstract: Newt Wallace, who at 93 is thought to be world's oldest newspaper delivery person, distributes The Winters Express in Winters, Calif; Wallace was publisher of the 2,300-circulation weekly, which he bought shortly after World War II, until he turned it over to his son in 1983.

byline.original: By CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY and MALIA WOLLAN

lead_paragraph: Newt Wallace, one of eight carriers for The Winters Express, has been walking the same blocks of downtown Winters, Calif. (population about 6,600) since 1947.

headline.seo: A 93-Year-Old Paperboy, Still Making the Rounds
headline.main: Hardy Survivor of a Vanishing Print Era Is Still Delivering the Newspaper at 93
headline.print_headline: Hardy Survivor of a Vanishing Print Era Is Still Delivering the Newspaper at 93
